page.title: 08Bells Yew Green Post Office
page.content: The{post office-general stores}is situated in the centre of Bells Yew Green, opposite the Brecknock Arms. The shop opens at 6.30am and closes at 5.30pm each week day, and they open on Saturday mornings. They are the{only shop for several miles around. The post office has been here since 1930 when it transferred from Frant Station nearby. Most of their regular customers are elderly. They sell{food, stationery, pharmaceutical {products}and toys at Christmas. The most commonly bought items are{sugar, {butter, milk, eggs, bread and {cigarettes.}The shop occupies the site of a bakery whose ovens are still there. The{weekly bill}for the shop is between Â£400 and Â£500 and the supplies are bought at Cash and Carry in{Rochester}every Tuesday. The shop is a good place to get{local news.
